citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
***There is a three week old female llama currently housed with her mother in a stall in the barn. The llama was observed
with a crusty exudate covering the eyelid of her left eye and she was holding her eye shut, possibly indicating the
presence of pain. Upon closer observation it appears the eye is severely ulcerated. The owner had not observed or been
made aware of this animal’s condition. Daily observations of all animals shall be made to assess their health and well-
being with timely and accurate information on problems noted and communicated to to the attending veterinarian.
The llama shall be examined by a veterinarian and appropriate treatment provided.
Correct by June 8, 2024

***The entry to the Nilgai shelter is very muddy with puddling water from recent rains. There is no dry access to the
shelter and the Nilgai must walk through a section of mud approximately 8 feet in length to enter the only shelter provided
in the enclosure. The muddy surface is slippery and may allow the Nilgai to lose their footing and become injured while
crossing.
Appropriate drainage shall be provided to prevent accumulations of standing water from heavy rains to eliminate the
accumulation of mud and protect the nilgai from possible injury.
Correct by June12, 2024.

***There are large accumulations of excreta in the llama and alpaca enclosures in the barn. The straw on the ground is
thick and appears saturated with excreta. Inadequate removal of soiled straw increases the risk of the presence of
disease hazards and contamination which may result in illness.
The enclosures shall be cleared of excreta and all old wet and dirty straw to allow the provision of clean dry surface area,
thereby providing for the health and wellbeing of the animals and minimizing the chance of contamination.
Correct by June 12, 2024.

***In the barn USDA observed an accumulation of dirty buckets, barrels, bags and bottles in a walkway closely adjacent to
an animal enclosure housing 2 goats. The area is cluttered and can become a haven for vermin which increases the risk
of disease and illness.
The barn shall be cleaned and maintained in a clutter free orderly manner to enable proper husbandry and protect the
animals from harm.
Correct by June 12, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
